definition: national flower (emblem, e.g. peony 牡丹[mu3 dan1] in China)
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful

sentences.english: Australia's National Floral Emblem is the golden wattle.
sentences.chinese: 澳大利亚的国花是金合欢花。

sentences.english: Vanda miss joaquim is the national flower of singapore.
sentences.chinese: 卓锦万代兰是新加坡的国花。

sentences.english: The national flower of Singapore is the Vanda Miss Joaquim.
sentences.chinese: 新加坡的国花是卓锦万带兰。

sentences.english: Although the plum flower, known as China's, but it is not publicity.
sentences.chinese: 虽然梅花被称为中国的国花，但是它并不张扬。

sentences.english: "Lotus is the national flower of India, " said Professor Tandon.
sentences.chinese: “莲花是印度的国花，”坦登教授说。

sentences.english: Tere sa is my National Flower.
In nineteen eighty-six, Congress chose the rose as America's national flower.
sentences.chinese: 1986年，美国国会选择了玫瑰作为国花。

sentences.english: The history of planting flowers is more than seven thousands years in China.
sentences.chinese: 中国花卉栽培有七千多年的历史。

sentences.english: In the middle of it, there is a Edelweiss , the national flower of Austria.
sentences.chinese: 其中间有个火绒草，它就是奥地利的国花。

sentences.english: Iris is the national flower of France.

definition: Mudan District of Heze City 菏澤市|菏泽市[He2 ze2 Shi4], Shandong/Mutan township in Pingtung County 屏東縣|屏东县[Ping2 dong1 Xian4], Taiwan
